pageContext.claim: “Michigan sends absentee ballot applications to 7.7 million people ahead of Primaries and the General Election. This was done illegally and without authorization by a rogue Secretary of State. I will ask to hold up funding to Michigan if they want to go down this Voter Fraud path!”
pageContext.analysis: Trump first tweeted falsely that Michigan was sending ballots -- not ballot applications -- to all registered voters. Then, he deleted the tweet and reposted it with the word "applications" added in. But the White House did not offer proof that Michigan's plans ran afoul of any laws. The state has vote-by-mail in its constitution. Michigan is sending out applications for absentee ballots in a move that the Republican National Committee says is kosher.
